flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500.0>>500.0 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500.0*$.0.25=$125.0<<500.0*0.25=125.0>>125.0 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500.0*$.0.5=$520.0<<500.0*0.5=520.0>>520.0 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $125.0+$520.0=$645.0<<125.0+520.0=645.0>>645.0 total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 250.0, not 520.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
